title: Power - energy dissipated in time Delta t

content.question: A resistor has resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and a constant current. An amount of charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> passes through a cross section of the resistor in an amount of time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></math>. How much energy is dissipated in the resistor during this time?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q R delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></math>
<math alttext="the fraction Q R over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction Q squared times R, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction Q squared times R, over, open parenthesis, delta t, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>R</mi></mrow><msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction Q squared times R, over delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
